subject: Climate & Environment
title: Perovskite: The Next Solar Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes Perovskite: The Next Solar Revolution usable.

hook.text: Silicon panels are great. But a crystal discovered in 1839 could make them obsolete.

buildup.text: Perovskite solar cells can be printed like ink on flexible sheets at low temperatures.

discovery.text: In just 15 years of research, perovskite efficiency jumped from 3.8% to over 33%.

twist.text: The catch: perovskites degrade quickly in moisture and heat. Durability is the bottleneck.

climax.text: Stacking perovskite on silicon creates tandem cells that break efficiency records.

punchline.text: The future of solar might be printed like a newspaper.

quiz.question: What is the main challenge for perovskite solar cells?
options: They degrade in moisture and heat
They only work in cold climates
